neighbors.name: Donald E. Thurston & Willa S. Thurston
neighbors.claims: Donald E. and Willa S. Thurston are listed as co-owners of a parcel in Granville County near Oxford ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/259/GIS-Geographic-Information-System#:~:text=The%20GIS%20,the%20beginning%20of%20each%20month)). They have no record of participation in local government meetings or public comments on development issues ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)). No news articles or civic roles could be found linking the Thurstons to community initiatives ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach personally through a familiar community member, emphasizing respect for their property and addressing any concerns about maintaining their quiet rural lifestyle.

neighbors.name: Bart A. Streb
neighbors.claims: Bart A. Streb is noted as a farmsteader at "J&B Farmstead" based in Oxford, NC ([www.signalhire.com](https://www.signalhire.com/profiles/bart-streb%27s-email/45534084#:~:text=Current%20Position%3A)). He operates a small farm enterprise and has decades of farming experience in the area ([www.signalhire.com](https://www.signalhire.com/profiles/bart-streb%27s-email/45534084#:~:text=Experience%3A)). There are no public records of Streb speaking in county meetings or media about development or energy projects ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via agricultural extension or farm community channels, highlighting how the project can coexist with and even support local farming interests.

neighbors.name: Paul Mayfield
neighbors.claims: Paul Mayfield owns property in the Oxford area of Granville County (PIN 0967-39-4251) but maintains a low public profile ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)). No meeting minutes or local news reports were found that mention Mayfield taking any public stance or holding community positions ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)). He is not listed among major farm subsidy recipients in the county, suggesting he is not a large-scale farm operator ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=1&z=1&zip=27565#:~:text=1995,%24%20263%2C631.46)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Invite Mayfield to an informational meeting or open house to hear his questions. Use a personal, respectful approach to build trust and understand any concerns he might have.

neighbors.name: Thomas "Woody" Gill Jr.
neighbors.claims: Thomas Woody Gill Jr. is a Granville County landowner with two parcels near Oxford ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/259/GIS-Geographic-Information-System#:~:text=The%20GIS%20,the%20beginning%20of%20each%20month)). He is locally known by the nickname "Woody," but there are no publicly documented civic roles or statements from him on development matters ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)). No local government or news records were found indicating Gill’s involvement in community decision-making ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Gill through a respectful one-on-one conversation, possibly with a mutual acquaintance. Emphasize understanding his family’s long-term connection to the land and address any legacy or land-use concerns.

neighbors.name: Alan B. Williams
neighbors.claims: Alan B. Williams is a prominent local farmer in Granville County, having received over $263,000 in USDA farm program payments since 1995 ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=1&z=1&zip=27565#:~:text=1995,%24%20263%2C631.46)). He owns multiple parcels near Oxford and is economically invested in agriculture in the area ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=1&z=1&zip=27565#:~:text=1995,%24%20263%2C631.46)). There is no record of Williams publicly commenting on development or energy projects in county archives or media ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/archives/2023-08/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Approved%20the%20purchase%20of,from%20County%20Manager%20Drew%20Cummings)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have an agricultural liaison (such as a respected Farm Bureau or extension agent) reach out to discuss the project’s impact on farming. Highlight how the development can safeguard farmland integrity and possibly provide tax or lease benefits.

neighbors.name: Harry Thorpe
neighbors.claims: County records show that land owned by Henry “Harry” Thorp Jr. and Mary Thorpe was requested for rezoning to allow a Duke Energy solar farm ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=348#:~:text=Duke%20Energy%20Progress%2C%20LLC%20is,a%20part%20of%20the%20application)). No public objections by Thorpe to development were found; instead, his property is actively part of a proposed solar energy project ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=348#:~:text=Duke%20Energy%20Progress%2C%20LLC%20is,a%20part%20of%20the%20application)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage his positive outlook on development. Engage him as a peer advocate, emphasizing community economic benefits and maintaining open communication about project progress.

neighbors.name: Rusti T. McCoy
neighbors.claims: Rusti T. McCoy owns parcel 0968-20-6765 in Oxford, NC according to county records ([tax.granvillecounty.org](https://tax.granvillecounty.org/ITSPublic/RealEstateSearch#:~:text=Return%20To%20Search%20Enter%20search,Alternate%20Parcel%20Identifier%20Property%20Address)). No meeting minutes or local news reports have mentioned McCoy taking any public position on development issues ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/779894#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Reappointing%20Dorothy%20Hunt%2C%20Larry,Community%20Center%20Board%20of%20Trustees)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach privately to share project information and listen to any concerns. A respectful, one-on-one conversation can help address questions given the lack of public stance.

neighbors.name: Haywood Smith Heirs
neighbors.claims: The parcel 0967-19-5542 is held under the name “Haywood Smith Heirs,” indicating it’s owned by the estate of the late Haywood Smith ([tax.granvillecounty.org](https://tax.granvillecounty.org/ITSPublic/#:~:text=Basic%20Search%20Return%20To%20Search,Land%20Units%2FType%20Alternate%20Parcel%20Identifier)). There are no publicly reported statements from the Smith family heirs regarding local development or energy projects ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/779894#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Reappointing%20Dorothy%20Hunt%2C%20Larry,Community%20Center%20Board%20of%20Trustees)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the estate’s representative and reach out through a community liaison. Emphasize respect for the family’s legacy and provide information on how the project can coexist with local heritage.

neighbors.name: Anthony Thorpe
neighbors.claims: Anthony Thorpe is listed as the owner of parcel 0968-21-2071 in Granville County (Oxford) ([tax.granvillecounty.org](https://tax.granvillecounty.org/ITSPublic/#:~:text=Basic%20Search%20Return%20To%20Search,Land%20Units%2FType%20Alternate%20Parcel%20Identifier)). No evidence could be found of Thorpe participating in public hearings or media coverage related to development or solar energy, suggesting no noted public stance ([farmlaw.ces.ncsu.edu](https://farmlaw.ces.ncsu.edu/2025/03/solar-development-sketches-from-a-county-hearing-on-ordinance-changes/#:~:text=moratorium%20,and%20the%20benefits%20of%20pollinator)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community figure familiar to the Thorpe family introduce the project. Since Anthony’s views are not known, focus on building trust and highlighting aspects like safety and respect for property.

neighbors.name: James E. Irvin
neighbors.claims: James E. Irvin appears as the owner of parcel 0968-21-6370 in county records ([tax.granvillecounty.org](https://tax.granvillecounty.org/ITSPublic/#:~:text=Basic%20Search%20Return%20To%20Search,Land%20Units%2FType%20Alternate%20Parcel%20Identifier)). There are no mentions of Irvin voicing opinions on local developments in available public records or news sources ([nextdoorradio.com](https://nextdoorradio.com/local-news/779894#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Reappointing%20Dorothy%20Hunt%2C%20Larry,Community%20Center%20Board%20of%20Trustees)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via personal outreach, possibly with a mutual acquaintance. Provide clear information about project impacts (noise, traffic) and offer to address any specific concerns he might have.

neighbors.name: Wayne Wilson
neighbors.claims: The Wilsons of Wilson Town Road are a long-established Granville County family ([www.gnvfuneralhome.com](https://www.gnvfuneralhome.com/obituaries/mary-belle-blackwell-wilson#:~:text=OXFORD%3A%20Mary%20Belle%20Blackwell%20Wilson%2C,Ruth%20Blackwell%20Coats%20of%20Garner)). County records show the Wilson family holding roughly 42 acres on Wilson Town Road, Oxford ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4110-Wilson-Town-Rd-LOT-3-Oxford-NC-27565/456293429_zpid/#:~:text=match%20at%20L243%20,Rd%2C%20Oxford%2C%20NC%2027565Off%20Market)), and several 1–4 acre lots from that tract have recently been listed for sale ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4110-Wilson-Town-Rd-LOT-3-Oxford-NC-27565/456293429_zpid/#:~:text=,LOT%201%2C%20Oxford%2C%20NC%2027565Lot%2FLand)). No public statements by Wayne Wilson on local development issues were found in available records ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/NewsFlash?cat=18#:~:text=Board%20of%20County%20Commissioners%20News)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime landowner; no public office held

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local farmer or family friend start an informal conversation, emphasizing respect for the Wilson family’s land legacy and how the project can coexist with farming traditions.

neighbors.name: Hardee Green et al
neighbors.claims: Hardee Green is listed as a Granville County landowner, with “et al” indicating the property is co-owned with other family members ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/259/GIS-Geographic-Information-System#:~:text=Granville%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina%20GIS,Hub)). There are no indications in local news or public records that Hardee Green has taken any active role in civic affairs or voiced opinions on development proposals ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/NewsFlash?cat=18#:~:text=Manage%20notification%20subscriptions%2C%20save%20form,Board%20of%20Commissioners)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Family-owned land; no civic roles noted

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a community figure they trust (e.g., an agricultural extension officer or neighbor) to discuss how the project can accommodate the family’s desire to preserve their land for future generations.

neighbors.name: Eric Lorrenzo Green
neighbors.claims: Eric Lorrenzo Green appears as an owner of a parcel in the Oxford area of Granville County ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/259/GIS-Geographic-Information-System#:~:text=Granville%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina%20GIS,Hub)). He does not feature in any available local civic records or media reports, and no public stance on development has been documented for him ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/NewsFlash?cat=18#:~:text=Board%20of%20County%20Commissioners%20News)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out with a neighborly visit by someone from the community to learn his concerns. Emphasize measures that protect the quiet rural character of the area and the continued use of surrounding land.

neighbors.name: James F. Greene
neighbors.claims: James F. Greene is identified as a Granville County property owner in the Oxford vicinity ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/259/GIS-Geographic-Information-System#:~:text=Granville%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina%20GIS,Hub)). He has no known involvement in local government or public commentary; no references to him were found in Granville County meeting minutes or news sources regarding development issues ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/NewsFlash?cat=18#:~:text=Manage%20notification%20subscriptions%2C%20save%20form,Board%20of%20Commissioners)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No leadership roles; low public visibility

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact via a local official or neighbor he knows, focusing on how the project will maintain property values and minimize disturbances to his daily life and privacy.

neighbors.name: Darryl Morton
neighbors.claims: A Granville County obituary in 2001 noted that a member of the Morton family owned a local logging company ([www.genlookups.com](https://www.genlookups.com/nc/webbbs_config.pl/noframes/read/983#:~:text=,will%20follow%20in%20Tranquility%20cemetery)), though Darryl Morton’s personal involvement in that business or any community leadership is not evident. Darryl Morton has no record of making public comments on development, and he has not been identified in local civic proceedings ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/NewsFlash?cat=18#:~:text=Manage%20notification%20subscriptions%2C%20save%20form,Board%20of%20Commissioners)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local family name; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him via a peer in the agricultural or logging community who can speak to preserving land use. In conversations, highlight how project plans include land restoration and safeguards to keep the area quiet and safe.

neighbors.name: Thompson Daizie L
neighbors.claims: No record of Daizie L. Thompson’s involvement in local civic meetings or public commentary was located in Granville County sources ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/newsflash?cat=18#:~:text=No%20,thompson)). She appears to be a private landowner with no evident public profile or stated views on development in the Oxford area ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/newsflash?cat=18#:~:text=No%20,thompson)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a personal visit or call by the project’s community liaison, stressing respect for her property and inviting her to share any questions or concerns.

neighbors.name: Green James Heirs
neighbors.claims: County records list the owner as “Green, James (Heirs),” indicating the property is held in an estate after James D. Green’s death in November 2021 ([obituary.memorial](https://obituary.memorial/en/obituary/james-d-green-1941-3-1-2021-11-23-955062#:~:text=Birth%20date%3A%20March%2001%2C%201941)). James Green was an Oxford resident who passed away at age 80 ([obituary.memorial](https://obituary.memorial/en/obituary/james-d-green-1941-3-1-2021-11-23-955062#:~:text=Birth%20date%3A%20March%2001%2C%201941)), and there is no public record of him or his heirs taking a stance on local development issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify and respectfully approach the estate’s representative or family, acknowledging the Green family’s legacy and listening to their priorities for the land’s future.

neighbors.name: Terry Ricky
neighbors.claims: Ricky Terry resides in Granville County but maintains a low public profile, with no mentions in local news or county meeting records as of 2025 ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/newsflash?cat=18#:~:text=No%20,terry)). There is no indication from public sources that he has voiced any position on development or energy projects in the community ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/newsflash?cat=18#:~:text=No%20,terry)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a friendly, informal outreach by a trusted community liaison to introduce the project and invite Mr. Terry to discuss any concerns or questions one-on-one.

neighbors.name: Pettiford Sandra Oliver
neighbors.claims: Sandra O. Pettiford (listed in records as Sandra J. Pettiford) was a long-time Oxford resident ([www.idcrawl.com](https://www.idcrawl.com/sandra-pettiford#:~:text=Sandra%20J%20Pettiford)). She passed away in November 2025 at age 66 ([www.echovita.com](https://www.echovita.com/us/obituaries/nc/oxford/sandra-pettiford-20555256#:~:text=Sandra%20J%20Pettiford)), and her property is now likely handled by her estate. No public statements from her regarding development or clean energy were found in local records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Work through family contacts or a community figure who knew Ms. Pettiford to reach her heirs, showing sensitivity to the family’s loss and emphasizing how the project can honor the community’s legacy.

neighbors.name: Corley Stoney
neighbors.claims: Stoney Corley is identified as a landowner in the vicinity of Oxford, NC, but he has no discernible public presence in local affairs ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/newsflash?cat=18#:~:text=No%20,corley)). There are no records of Corley participating in county meetings or voicing opinions on development, suggesting he stays out of the public spotlight ([www.granvillecounty.org](https://www.granvillecounty.org/m/newsflash?cat=18#:~:text=No%20,corley)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Corley through a cordial, face-to-face introduction by a local community liaison, emphasizing respect for his privacy and explaining the project’s measures to minimize disruption.

neighbors.name: Bonnie A. Dickerson
neighbors.claims: The Dickerson family has deep agricultural roots in Granville County; a Dickerson farm has been in operation since at least 1878 [NC Department of Agriculture](https://www.ncagr.gov/divisions/public-affairs/century-farms/EFG-Counties). A family member, Robert L. Dickerson of Oxford, received over $145,000 in federal farm subsidies, indicating active participation in local farming programs [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=1&z=1&zip=27565).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a respected farm community member and emphasize how the development can support farmland preservation and honor the Dickersons’ century-long family legacy.

neighbors.name: Beverly Fleming
neighbors.claims: Beverly Fleming Ramey, 86, was a longtime resident of Franklinton, NC, and worked for many years at a local bank and other businesses in Franklin County [City of Oaks Cremation](https://www.cityofoakscremation.com/obituaries/article-271/). She passed away in November 2023, suggesting her Oxford property is now likely held by her estate and family heirs [City of Oaks Cremation](https://www.cityofoakscremation.com/obituaries/article-271/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Lived outside community; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to her Oxford-based family members and emphasize the project’s minimal disruption along with any benefits that maintain the land’s value and quiet rural character.

neighbors.name: Yancey Properties Inc
neighbors.claims: Yancey Properties, Inc. is an Oxford-based real estate agency specializing in residential and commercial rental properties [MapQuest](https://www.mapquest.com/us/north-carolina/yancey-properties-3184742). The company is a member of the Granville County Chamber of Commerce and actively supports local economic development and community relations [MapQuest](https://www.mapquest.com/us/north-carolina/yancey-properties-3184742).
neighbors.influence_justification: Prominent local rental property firm; active in Chamber of Commerce

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage owners through business community channels (e.g., Chamber), highlighting the project’s economic benefits; address any concerns about property values upfront to maintain a cooperative stance

neighbors.name: Pleasant Hills Farm LLC
neighbors.claims: Pleasant Hills Farm LLC is a North Carolina limited liability company holding farmland in the Oxford area with no public-facing operations beyond land ownership [Better Business Bureau](https://www.bbb.org/us/nc/oxford/category/farm). The farm is not listed in local business or farm directories, indicating it functions as a private agricultural landholding without commercial retail activity [Better Business Bureau](https://www.bbb.org/us/nc/oxford/category/farm).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family farm holding; minimal economic or political influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the owners with respect for their farming heritage; offer assurances (e.g., buffers, fair compensation) so the project addresses any concerns about impacts on their land’s use or value

neighbors.name: Richard Lewis Taylor Revocable Trust
neighbors.claims: See RESIDENT table.
neighbors.influence_justification: Trust tied to individual landowner; no organizational role publicly evident

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate through the trust’s trustee or family representative; treat this as an individual landowner engagement focusing on personal concerns and estate considerations

overview_summary: None of the identified neighbors have a documented stance for or against development, as no public records show explicit support or opposition. All five maintain low public profiles in the community, with no high-ranking officials among them; only one (Alan B. Williams) stands out as a significant local farmer with moderate economic presence. Of the five neighboring landowners, one has explicitly supported new development by leasing land for a Duke Energy solar farm, while none have been publicly documented opposing it. The majority (four) have no recorded stance on development or clean energy. Community influence appears limited overall, with only one high-influence neighbor who is a major landowner involved in a local project. None of the five profiled landowners have a documented stance either supporting or opposing the proposed development (all are classified as "unknown" in noted stance). All appear to have limited community influence, as none hold public office or prominent leadership roles locally. Most are long-time landowners with deep personal ties to their property, but no high-influence community figures were identified among them. None of these five neighboring owners have a documented public stance on development or energy projects, as no explicit support or opposition statements were found. All appear to be private landholders with low public profiles, and none hold high-influence positions in the community. Both neighbors have an unclear stance on new development, with no public statements found from either. One neighbor is part of a century-long farming family in the area (moderate community influence), while the other is a recently deceased owner’s estate with minimal local profile. Neighbors include a local real estate company and two private landholding entities, indicating mostly local ownership without large corporate developers. Yancey Properties Inc is a rental property firm likely supportive of economic growth, whereas Pleasant Hills Farm LLC and the Taylor Trust are individual/family-held farmlands that may prioritize rural preservation or favorable land deals. None appear to be major organized opposition backers, but the farm owners could raise concerns about land use changes.
